title: Supabase Cloud Overview
description:
## Supabase

This dashboard provides a high-level overview of your Supabase projects so you can monitor logs and metrics.
  
Clone this template to make changes and add your own graphs and widgets.

definition.content:
This dashboard provides a high-level overview of your Supabase deployment to help monitor your system.

Metrics are displayed within the groups on this left column, in purple. The metrics express health and activity for your Supabase project Postgres server database and OS.

When multiple Postgres servers are present in the project, use the _identifier_ filter, above, to isolate metrics to a single server.

Log-derived graphs and lists constitute the green groupings. Logs are collected either via Datadog polling the Supabase Management API or via a Supabase Log Drain. See the Integration description for the enablement options.

The log messages are assigned `service` values in the range _auth_logs_, _edge_logs_, _edge_function_logs_, _edge_function_invocation_logs_, _postgres_logs_, _mgmt_api_logs_, _realtime_logs_, _storage_logs_, and _postgrest_logs_.

**References**

- [Supabase Logging](https://supabase.com/docs/guides/telemetry/logs)

The load average represents the average number of processes that are either running on the CPU, waiting to run on the CPU, or in an uninterruptible sleep state (typically waiting for I/O operations). 

Presented here are the average loads over the past 1 minute, 5 minutes, and 15 minutes where the percentage load is computed based on available CPU. For example, on a 4-core CPU, a load average of 3 means 75% utilization. If all three averages (1, 5, 15 min) are consistently over 100%, it suggests a sustained heavy workload. A value of 100% does not necessarily imply an overloaded system, rather a fully utilized system.

definition.title: DB Database Size Change from Last Month

definition.content:
The audit logs, `service: mgmt_api_logs`, are available only when using a Supabase Log Drain. 

This log stream records all interaction with the Supabase Management API and UI.

To see which SQL statements are taking longer than expected to execute, set `log_min_duration_statement` to a millisecond value on each Postgres role which executes the statements. See the [Supabase documentation](https://supabase.com/docs/guides/database/custom-postgres-config).
